TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LivePipelineUpdate extends Microsoft.Azure.Management.VideoAnalyzer.Models.ProxyResource

Docs.summary: Live pipeline represents a unique instance of a live topology, used for real-time ingestion, archiving and publishing of content for a unique RTSP camera.

new Microsoft.Azure.Management.VideoAnalyzer.Models.LivePipelineUpdate : string * string * string * Microsoft.Azure.Management.VideoAnalyzer.Models.SystemData * string * string * Nullable<int> * Microsoft.Azure.Management.VideoAnalyzer.Models.LivePipelineState * System.Collections.Generic.IList<Microsoft.Azure.Management.VideoAnalyzer.Models.ParameterDefinition> -> Microsoft.Azure.Management.VideoAnalyzer.Models.LivePipelineUpdate
MemberSignature.Usage: new Microsoft.Azure.Management.VideoAnalyzer.Models.LivePipelineUpdate (id, name, type, systemData, topologyName, description, bitrateKbps, state, parameters)

Docs.param: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}
The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"
Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.
The reference to an existing pipeline topology defined for real-time content processing. When activated, this live pipeline will process content according to the pipeline topology definition.
An optional description for the pipeline.

Maximum bitrate capacity in Kbps reserved for the live pipeline. The allowed range is from 500 to 3000 Kbps in increments of 100 Kbps. If the RTSP camera exceeds this capacity, then the service will disconnect temporarily from the camera. It will retry to re-establish connection (with exponential backoff), checking to see if the camera bitrate is now below the reserved capacity. Doing so will ensure that one 'noisy neighbor' does not affect other live pipelines in your account.
Current state of the pipeline (read-only). Possible values include: 'Inactive', 'Activating', 'Active', 'Deactivating'

List of the instance level parameter values for the user-defined topology parameters. A pipeline can only define or override parameters values for parameters which have been declared in the referenced topology. Topology parameters without a default value must be defined. Topology parameters with a default value can be optionally be overridden.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LivePipelineUpdate class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets maximum bitrate capacity in Kbps reserved for the live pipeline. The allowed range is from 500 to 3000 Kbps in increments of 100 Kbps. If the RTSP camera exceeds this capacity, then the service will disconnect temporarily from the camera. It will retry to re-establish connection (with exponential backoff), checking to see if the camera bitrate is now below the reserved capacity. Doing so will ensure that one 'noisy neighbor' does not affect other live pipelines in your account.
